qas.question: The Social Chapter is a chapter of what treaty?
What year was the Treaty of Amsterdam created?
When was the basis for the Social Chapter developed?
How many general principles does the Social Charter declare?
How many pieces of legislation has the Social Charter become the basis for?
What treaty is the Social Chapter not a chapter of?
What year was the Treaty of Amsterdam rejected by the European Union law?

plausible_answers.text: The basis for the Social Chapter

qas.question: What was developed in the 1980's by the social partners representatives?
How many general principles does the the Social Charter not declare?
How many pieces of legislation has the Social Charter not become the basis for?

context: The Social Chapter is a chapter of <a0_1><a0_2>the <a0_0><a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b5_0><b6_0>1997<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> Treaty of Amsterdam<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> covering social policy issues in European Union law. <b7_0>The basis for the Social Chapter<b7_0/> was developed in <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>1989<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> by the "social partners" representatives, namely UNICE, the employers' confederation, the European Trade Union Confederation (ETUC) and CEEP, the European Centre of Public Enterprises. A toned down version was adopted as the Social Charter at the 1989 Strasbourg European Council. The Social Charter declares <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>30<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> general principles, including on fair remuneration of employment, health and safety at work, rights of disabled and elderly, the rights of workers, on vocational training and improvements of living conditions. The Social Charter became the basis for European Community legislation on these issues in <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b9_0>40<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> pieces of legislation.
